Pre-Game Insights: Hossam Hassan has worked closely with his players to prepare for this encounter, urging them to focus on scoring an early goal and maintaining balance between attack and defense.

Injuries have forced Hassan to make adjustments to his lineup. Key players like Imam Ashour, Omar Marmoush, and Mostafa Mohamed are unavailable due to injury, and experienced defender Ahmed Hegazy will miss the match due to personal reasons.
Despite these setbacks, Hassan has opted to retain Hamdi Fathi and Rami Rabia in central defense, while relying on Mohamed Elneny, Marawan Attia, and Zizo to control the midfield.

The attack will feature a formidable trio of Mohamed Salah, Trezeguet, and Osama Faisal. Salah, Egypt’s captain and key player, will lead the offensive charge, with his pace and finishing ability expected to be crucial in breaking down Botswana’s defense.
Trezeguet’s creativity and Osama Faisal’s presence as a central striker will complement Salah’s efforts, providing Egypt with a balanced and potent attack.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will kick off at 7:00 PM Cairo time at the Francistown Stadium in Botswana, which has a capacity of 26,000 spectators.
Egypt currently leads the group with 3 points, tied with Mauritania on goal difference, while Botswana is in third place with no points.
This match is crucial for both teams, as Egypt looks to solidify its position at the top of the group, while Botswana hopes to gain their first points.
